result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody A. Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: SHALL RECEIVE 1 DAY PRESENTENCE CREDIT SHOULD SUPERVISION BE REVOKED

miscConds.notes: Must obtain/maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.
  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.
May petition the Court for expungment upon successful completion of supervision
Defendant shall obtain a valid Wisconsin driver's license.

4/16/15: Court amends conditional jail time to include HUBER FOR EMPLOYMENT AND TREATMENT for the balance of the sentence.

Defendant, Cody A. Anderson FTA, there are no other appearances.  Probation is extended for 12 mos per recomendation of the agent.  Case recalled @ 1:33 pm.  Defendant now appears in person.  Defendant objecting to extension of probation, indicates paid in full.  All payments were made to the District Attorney's Office.  Court called agent, Marjorie Scharf, left voice mail.  Court adjourns for the agent to call back.  Case recalled.  Agent Marjorie Scharf appearing by phone.  Ms. Scharf states there is a balance owed on restitution of $1,250 and $643 for court costs.  Defendant's discharge date is August 6th, court reschedules . Review (NC) scheduled for August 2, 2017 at 10:00 am.

(10:03) Defendant Cody A. Anderson in court, in custody with attorney David Zarwell. Kurt Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. This is motion to revoke DPA filed by State; State heard - will not proceed today with motion to revoke - has reached agreement with Atty. Zarwell for conditions for Def. to meet; State requests this be postponed 30-45 days; Atty. Zarwell heard - Def. sitting 90 days on conditional jail on 14CF20, does have huber for treatment; requests huber for employment; State now heard on restitution and requests correct filled in form; Court notes there isn't one, amounts were noted on the record at the hearing; Court prints out order and fills in amounts - will be refiled; cases 14CF20 and 14CF146 also called; Court notes that issues on those cases were not scheduled to be called today; discussion held; Court now calls 14CF20 to address the issue of huber; Court amends the conditional jail time to include huber for employment and treatment for balance of sentence; this case is rescheduled for 6/23/15 at 1:00pm

Case called along with 14CF20 and 14CF146.  Defendant Cody A. Anderson in Court with Attorney David Zarwell.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Restitution Hearing. Victims Rights are compliant.  Parties stipulate to using the DPA in 13CF383 and will add restitution amounts to that document on the record.  Parties stipulate to no rest. in 14CF146, in 13CF383, $289.98 is stipulated to for the victim in this case-victim was present and agreeable, and as to 14CFCF20 is owed to victim Dylan Turner, per stipulation.   These amounts are to be added to the JOC.  Attorney Zarwell asked for credit in 14CF167, case then called by the Court.   Defendant pled to a a misd. in that case. Attorney Zarwell recited the days of credit on three cases:  13CF383, one day of presentence credit, to be applied against any revocation;  in 14CF20, one day of presentence credit to be applied against any revocation; and in 14CF167,  seven days of presetence credit, however, no jail was ordered in that case.
Probation Intake Order
Restitution hearing on September 19, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 6, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
